intro: Flourensia hirta, commonly known as the hairy flourensia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Flourensia hirta is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
